header: Cri. Bail Appl. No. 39/2019 (CNR No. : MHPU01­000144­2019) Kaushal Naik & Ors. Vs. State of Maharashtra

background.text: ORDER BELOW EXH. 4 1] This is an application for Ad­interim Anticipatory Bail under Section 438 of the Code of Criminal Procedure in respect of Crime No. 333/2018 registered under Sections 498­A, 323, 504, 506 read with section 34 of Indian Penal Code at Police Station, Sinhgad Road, Pune.

legalActFound.stringMatched: under section 438 of the code of criminal procedure
under sections 498­a, 323, 504, 506 read with section 34 of indian penal code

arguments.text: 2] Informant Madhura Kaushal Naik is wife of Applicant No. 1. Rest of the Applicants are her in laws. She alleged that, she married with Applicant No. 1 on 19/12/2016. Then, all Applicants ill­treated her for domestic reasons. Applicant No. 1 insisted her for doing job and had assaulted her by slapping. Rest of the Applicants also ill­treated her by threatening and by abusing. Therefore, she lodged the report.

argumentSentences.text: 2] Informant Madhura Kaushal Naik is wife of Applicant No. 1.
Rest of the Applicants are her in laws.
She alleged that, she married with Applicant No. 1 on 19/12/2016.
Then, all Applicants ill­treated her for domestic reasons.
Applicant No. 1 insisted her for doing job and had assaulted her by slapping.
Rest of the Applicants also ill­treated her by threatening and by abusing.
Therefore, she lodged the report.

arguments.text: 3] Applicants submit that, they have no committed any crime. Within short period of marriage, Informant has made general allegations of ill­treatment. Applicant No. 2 and 3 reside at different places. Therefore, there is no question of ill­treatment by these Applicants. Moreover, no immediate recovery is pending against them. They are reputed persons having roots in the society. Hence, they pray for interim protection.

argumentSentences.text: 3] Applicants submit that, they have no committed any crime.
Within short period of marriage, Informant has made general allegations of ill­treatment.
Applicant No. 2 and 3 reside at different places.
Therefore, there is no question of ill­treatment by these Applicants.
Moreover, no immediate recovery is pending against them.
They are reputed persons having roots in the society.
Hence, they pray for interim protection.

arguments.text: 4] Heard learned Adv. Moh. Taher Khan for Applicants. Perused the FIR and Papers.

argumentSentences.text: 4] Heard learned Adv. Moh.
Taher Khan for Applicants.
Perused the FIR and Papers.

arguments.text: 5] Prima facie, the role attributed to present Applicants is about ill­treatment to Informant for domestic reasons. No immediate recovery is pending against Applicants. Applicants do not have any criminal antecedents. Their presence can be secured by putting suitable conditions. Hence, I prefer to pass following Order.

argumentSentences.text: 5] Prima facie, the role attributed to present Applicants is about ill­treatment to Informant for domestic reasons.
No immediate recovery is pending against Applicants.
Applicants do not have any criminal antecedents.
Their presence can be secured by putting suitable conditions.
Hence, I prefer to pass following Order.

order.text: ORDER 1] Application is allowed. 2] Pending herein final disposal of main application, in the event of arrest in Crime No. 333/2018 registered under Sections 498­A, 323, 504, 506 read with section 34 of Indian Penal Code at Police Station, Sinhgad Road, Pune Applicants 1] Kaushal Mukund Naik, 2] Jayshri Mukund Naik, 3] Mukund Prabhakar Naik, 4] Kaushik Mukund Naik be released on bail on furnishing P.B. and S.B. of Rs. 15,000/­ (Rupees Fifteen Thousand) each on the following conditions : [A] Applicants shall make themselves available for interrogation by a Police Officer as and when required. [B] Applicants shall not, directly or indirectly, make any inducement, threat or promise to any person acquainted with the facts of the case so as to dissuade him from disclosing such facts to the Court or to any police officer. 3] Issue Notice to respondent state returnable on 10/01/2019. 4] Intimate to concern Police Station.

processedText:
Cri. Bail Appl. No. 39/2019 (CNR No. : MHPU01­000144­2019) Kaushal Naik & Ors. Vs. State of Maharashtra 
---header-ends---
ORDER BELOW EXH. 4 1] This is an application for Ad­interim Anticipatory Bail under Section 438 of the Code of Criminal Procedure in respect of Crime No. 333/2018 registered under Sections 498­A, 323, 504, 506 read with section 34 of Indian Penal Code at Police Station, Sinhgad Road, Pune. 
---background-ends---
2] Informant Madhura Kaushal Naik is wife of Applicant No. 1. Rest of the Applicants are her in laws. She alleged that, she married with Applicant No. 1 on 19/12/2016. Then, all Applicants ill­treated her for domestic reasons. Applicant No. 1 insisted her for doing job and had assaulted her by slapping. Rest of the Applicants also ill­treated her by threatening and by abusing. Therefore, she lodged the report. 
---argument-ends---
3] Applicants submit that, they have no committed any crime. Within short period of marriage, Informant has made general allegations of ill­treatment. Applicant No. 2 and 3 reside at different places. Therefore, there is no question of ill­treatment by these Applicants. Moreover, no immediate recovery is pending against them. They are reputed persons having roots in the society. Hence, they pray for interim protection. 
---argument-ends---
4] Heard learned Adv. Moh. Taher Khan for Applicants. Perused the FIR and Papers. 
---argument-ends---
5] Prima facie, the role attributed to present Applicants is about ill­treatment to Informant for domestic reasons. No immediate recovery is pending against Applicants. Applicants do not have any criminal antecedents. Their presence can be secured by putting suitable conditions. Hence, I prefer to pass following Order. 
---argument-ends---
ORDER 1] Application is allowed. 2] Pending herein final disposal of main application, in the event of arrest in Crime No. 333/2018 registered under Sections 498­A, 323, 504, 506 read with section 34 of Indian Penal Code at Police Station, Sinhgad Road, Pune Applicants 1] Kaushal Mukund Naik, 2] Jayshri Mukund Naik, 3] Mukund Prabhakar Naik, 4] Kaushik Mukund Naik be released on bail on furnishing P.B. and S.B. of Rs. 15,000/­ (Rupees Fifteen Thousand) each on the following conditions : [A] Applicants shall make themselves available for interrogation by a Police Officer as and when required. [B] Applicants shall not, directly or indirectly, make any inducement, threat or promise to any person acquainted with the facts of the case so as to dissuade him from disclosing such facts to the Court or to any police officer. 3] Issue Notice to respondent state returnable on 10/01/2019. 4] Intimate to concern Police Station. 
---order-ends---
